alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 12:07AM EDT until April 08 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING EXTENDED UNTIL 7 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following county, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1202 AM EDT, the gauge at Aldenville on the West Branch of the Lackawaxen as of 1130 PM was 6.92 feet and remains in flood stage. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.0 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aldenville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
